intro.description:
Welcome to the XML Encryption tutorial of the XML-Security Plug-In.
This tutorial will show you step by step how to encrypt a new XML document using the Encryption Wizard. This tutorial shows only some possibilities of the XML Encryption Wizard and will give you some ideas on how to use it and what you can do with it. You will create a project and an XML document to encrypt. To start this encrypting session click the 'Click to Begin' button below. You can skip the first item if you already have a project and an opened XML document.
By the way, this tutorial shows only some possibilities of the XML Encryption Wizard. You can find more information in the extensive German online help and on the home page of the XML-Security Plug-In.

item.title: Create a new project and sample document
item.description:
The first step is to create a new project (your XML documents must be part of a project to work properly with the XML-Security Plug-In). It doesn't matter what type of project, the best type is of course an XML project. After that create a new XML document with arbitrary elements, attributes and everything you want to encrypt.
It is advisable to start with a small XML document and to extend it step by step. You can create a sample project and a sample XML document automatically by clicking on the 'Click to Perform' link below. You can skip this step ('Click to Skip' link) if you already have a project and a contained XML document.

item.title: Resource and Encryption Type
item.description:
Now it's time to actually encrypt your XML document. Start the XML Encryption Wizard by clicking on 'New Encryption...' in the context menu 'XML Security'. The wizard consists of three pages.
On the first page you have to select the resource you want to encrypt (the complete document, a text selection or a node defined by an XPath expression). In order to encrypt a text selection you must select a well-formed part of your XML document before you start the wizard. By activating 'Encrypt only element content' the root element of your document (or selection) will remain as plain text.

item.title: Algorithms
item.description:
On the last page of the Encryption Wizard you have to select different algorithms.
After that you have to select a file in which you want to store the key used for encryption. Keep this file in a save place, you will need it again for decryption.
Finally you can enter an id to identify your encryption (recommended).
By selecting the 'Start XML Signature Wizard afterwards' checkbox the XML Signature Wizard will be called after the signature is created.
The document will be encrypted after clicking on 'Finish'.
